10.question:
As atomic number increases, what happens to the 
atomic radius of an element? Therefore, which element 
has the larger atomic radius, Chlorine or Mercury?
10.answer:
Atomic radius increases as atomic number increases,
 because more energy levels means a bigger atom; Mercury

15.question: What is the difference between ionic bonds and covalent bonds?
15.answer:
In ionic bonding, the cation transfers electrons to the 
anion, while in covalent bonding, electrons are shared
 between the two ions.

22.question:
Which group on the periodic table has a full set of 
valence electrons? Are the elements in this group highly reactive?
22.answer: Noble gases have 8 valence electrons; no, they are non-reactive

25.question: What is synthesis and decomposition?
25.answer:
They are chemical reactions in which synthesis will join two
 single elements together into a compound and decomposition
 will separate a compound into two different elements.

26.question:
What is the difference between Single-Replacement
 and Double-Replacement?
26.answer:
Single-Replacement transfers an element into a 
compound and kicks another out, and Double-Replacement
 switches the elements in two compounds with each other.

27.question: What is combustion?
27.answer: A chemical reaction in which the products of the reaction are CO2 and H2O
